day, Bill noticed a big patch of weeds in the middle of his field. He sighed, for weeds meant that the crops would be harder to harvest. 
Bill called his children to his side, and explained that he wanted them to help him with the weeds. His children were tired and wanted to play, but they could see how tired and worried Bill was, so they agreed. 
The children worked all day, and soon, the patch of weeds was gone. Bill smiled and thanked his children, and they all went back home to have dinner.

One day, the wolf approached a three year old child playing nearby.
"Hello," said the wolf.
The toddler was taken aback and froze in fear.
But then, he replied, "Hi, Wolf!"
The wolf was surprised that the toddler understood it. He smiled and said, "Would you like to be my friend?". 
The toddler was overjoyed. His eyes lit up, and he smiled back. 
He nodded and said, "Yes!".
